intro: Lygodesmia texana, commonly known as Texas greenbriar, is a woody vine native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale green and are clustered in small inflorescences. Lygodesmia texana is adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both sunny and partially shaded environments.
